author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Wegmans lists Halloween candy by allergen
text:
Dum-Dums, Tootsie Pops, Junior Mints and several other types of Halloween treats offered by Wegmans Food Markets is being marked in a special chart identifying candy by type of gluten or food allergen. The chart lists the brand of candy by name, size and UPC code, marking it with a "no" if it does not contain a gluten/wheat, peanut, tree nut, egg, milk or soy allergen. For example, fun-size Starburst candies do not contain gluten/wheat, peanuts, or tree nuts but they may contain egg, dairy or a soy allergy, according to the chart.
Buy Photo Wegmans has posted signs in the candy aisle to help customers understand the food allergens in many different types of candies. (Photo: Jamie Germano/@jgermano1/, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER)
"If you or someone in your family has food allergies, you have a game plan, but if you're buying treats for someone else's child who may have a food allergy, you'll be shopping for something you don't typically buy, and that can be tricky," said Jane Andrews, Wegmans' corporate nutrition and product labeling manager. "Easy access to this information online and in the store can be a relief to the customer who may be looking for candy that's peanut-free or dairy-free to bring into a classroom, a party, or to hand out to trick-or-treaters."
Overall, more than 30 items appearing in the grocer's Halloween section and eight items available year-round in its fruit snack aisle are listed on the chart at Wegmans.com/pdf/halloweenAllergens.pdf. Wegmans developed the chart after consulting its suppliers and receiving questions from shoppers on the ingredients of the Halloween candy available at its stores.
Buy Photo Wegmans has posted signs in the candy aisle to help customers understand the food allergens in many different types of candies. (Photo: Jamie Germano/@jgermano1/, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER)
"More than six months ago, we began reaching out to our Halloween candy suppliers, asking if they'd like to participate by verifying allergen statements and carefully checking ingredient lists so that we could gather the information into one simple reference chart," said Wegmans Category Merchant Jennifer Komendat, who oversees candy.
Signs have been posted in many Halloween candy areas in stores pointing customers to the chart, which also can be printed out at customer service desks, according to the Gates-based grocer.
Customers with questions can call Wegmans Consumer Affairs Department, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday-Friday at (585) 464-4760, or (800) 934-6267, ext. 4760.
